official_title: Expressing the sense of the Congress that the President should continue to levy stringent economic sanctions against Iraq, rather than resort to military action, and that any decision to use offensive military action must be executed only with the full consent of the Congress.

summary.text: Expresses the sense of the Congress that: (1) the President should continue to levy stringent economic sanctions against Iraq, rather than resort to military action; and (2) any decision to use offensive military action must be executed only with the full consent of the Congress.

titles.title: Expressing the sense of the Congress that the President should continue to levy stringent economic sanctions against Iraq, rather than resort to military action, and that any decision to use offensive military action must be executed only with the full consent of the Congress.
